title.narrative: OUTPUT 3.1: INSTITUTIONAL Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) CAPACITY

description.narrative: Communities and institutions gain and maintain access to improved, gender-sensitive and climate-resilient Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services in rural and peri-urban areas., which contributes to Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance, Disaster Risk Reduction, Disaster Risk Reduction (Covid), Environmental Sustainability, Sanitation, Water, Water (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2024, children and their families in selected rural and urban areas, including in humanitarian settings, live in a climate- resilient environment and use safe and sustainable water, sanitation and hygiene (WASH) services.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Communities and institutions gain and maintain access to improved, gender-sensitive and climate-resilient WASH services in rural and peri-urban areas.
Existence of water, sanitation and hygiene sector budgeting mechanism
Existence of Child sensitive national or local risk management plans addressing risks related to disasters, climate change, conflict, public health emergencies or other crises

[Existence of a government strategic document on norms and standards in menstrual health and hygiene in the DRC] Existence d'un document stratgique gouvernemental sur les normes et standards dans le domaine de la sant et hygine menstruelle en RDC.
Existence of sector regulation and accountability mechanisms for water, sanitation and hygiene
Local governments (incl. municipalities) with functioning coordination mechanisms to strengthen the delivery of child focused services
(alt) Number of government facilities and other public spaces consistently applying IPC protocols developed with UNICEF-support in the reporting year [COVID]
